ovdesc.p: This table stores the IBAN structure per country.

desc.p: Unique Identifier, system generated
The country name of the institution/branch as indicated in ISO 3166
Used for internal purpose.Holds the ID of the current live record of store table PPT.COUNTRYIBANSTRUCTURE. This field can hold upto 65 alphanumeric characters.
No Input field
Specifies the date on which the record is to be considered inactive by the payments hub.
Indicates if the country is a home country of the company. This is used for Companies that have more
than one country as a local country.
For example, GB covers United Kingdom, Isle of Man, Jersey etc.
This plays a key role in identifying of the payment is a domestic or an international payment.
Possible values
Y - Home country of the company
N - Not a home country of the company
Number of check digits in the IBAN
Start position of bank identifier in the IBAN
ISO country code prefix in the IBAN
Number of characters of the country code in the IBAN
Start position of the country code in IBAN
Number of characters of account number in IBAN
Y – IBAN is mandatory for sending messages to this country.
N – IBAN is not mandatory for sending messages to this country.
Y – IBAN is mandatory for sending MT103+ to this country.
N – IBAN is not mandatory for sending MT103+ to this country.
Number of significant characters of the National ID value that are used by
SWIFT to populate the IBAN NATIONAL ID, and that are sufficient to derive the
IBAN BIC correctly. This number can be different from (that is, smaller than) the
length of the national bank/branch identifier defined in the IBAN Registry. Note
that as SWIFT refines its IBAN to BIC translation algorithms, this number may
change from release to release.
Structure of the IBAN.
A = Alpha value (A-Z)
N = numeric value (0-9)
X = Alphanumeric (A-Z + 0-9)
For example, for an IBAN of NL, the IBAN structure can be stored as follows.
AANNAAAANNNNNNNNNN.
An NL IBAN is validated against this structure.
The total number of characters of the IBAN
Standard T24 alphanumeric field.
Validation Rules
A maximum of 15 characters may be entered.
ISO currency code
ISO currency name
Required to derive a BIC from an IBAN
As the IBANNationalID is not the same as the NationalID but the NationalID will
be mostly part of the IBANNationalID, NationalIDLength and NationalIDPosition
are added to convert the NationalID from the IBANnationaliD and for routing and
settlement to find the NationalID from the IBAN.
Start position of the account number in IBAN
Start position of the NationalID Position
Used for internal purpose.Holds the ID of the current live record of store table PPT.COUNTRYIBANSTRUCTURE. This field can hold upto 15 alphanumeric characters.
No Input field

Contains all the override messages which the user agreed to during Input. During the validation of a transaction, the system may provide the user with a series of screen override messages to indicate an anomaly.
If this field is ‘N’ then it implies that the data entry will never be updated by
the upload process. If set to ‘Y’ then the data can be overridden by the upload
process.
Record Activation Code generated for the record by the payment's hub.
Possible values:
N - Not active
A - Active
H-YYYYMMDDHHMMSSsss - History. Where: YYYY - year, MM - month, DD - day, HH - hour, MM - minutes, SS - seconds and sss - miliseconds
F - Future
C - Not active future
Validation Rules:
19 alphanumeric characters.
The value is not editable by the user.
Record Status Code generated for the record by the payments hub.
Possible values:
L - Live
U - Unapproved
R - Reversed
MF - Modified future
Validation Rules:
1 alphanumeric character.
The value is not editable by the user.
Specifies the date on which the record is to be considered active by the payments hub.
This field will specify the first non-working day in the week. For example,
Saturday.
This field will specify the second non-working day (if any) in the week. For
example, Sunday
Used for internal purpose. Value of this field determines values of fields, 'RAC' and 'RSC'
Possible values:
N - New
M - Modified
R - Reverse
This field can hold upto 1 alphanumeric character and the value is not editable by the user.
Start position of the branch identifier in the IBAN (value is empty if the branch
identifier is not applied in the country's IBAN format)
Start position of the branch identifier in the IBAN (value is empty if the branch
identifier is not applied in the country's IBAN format)
Number of characters of bank identifier in the IBAN
Start position of bank identifier in the IBAN
Indicates the company ID for which the record is created.
Example : BNK,GB1
Validation Rules:
Mandatory field
3 alphanumeric characters.
The value links to the field ‘CompanyID’ in PPT.COMPANY
Country Code in ISO format
